title: 'Terminator' star Linda Hamilton on why she ditched Hollywood – and what lured her back
text:
Linda Hamilton's life in The Big Easy is a far cry from Hollywood.

“I know people here after four years better than I ever knew anyone in Malibu,” the 62-year-old actress told The New York Times in a profile published Tuesday.

Hamilton, who will be back as Sarah Connor for November's "Terminator: Dark Fate,” gave up her Malibu digs in 2012.

“I woke up one day and I was like, ‘Well, here I am in my beautiful mansion and my kids aren’t here, my agents aren’t calling, and this is not real,’” the mother of two – Dalton Abbott, 29, and Josephine Archer Cameron, 26 – said.

Hamilton, who was previously married to both of her kids' fathers – actor Bruce Abbott (1982–1989) and director James Cameron (1997–1999) – is now happily unattached.

"I love my alone time like no one you’ve ever met,” she told the Times. "I’ve been celibate for at least 15 years. One loses track, because it just doesn’t matter – or at least it doesn’t matter to me. I have a very romantic relationship with my world every day and the people who are in it.”

And it's her low-key life that made it hard to return for the upcoming "Terminator" flick, after Cameron (who directed and co-wrote "Terminator" and its sequel) sent her a letter asking her to reprise the role.

“That was my hesitation: Do I want to trade this lovely, authentic life for that? I didn’t want my neighbors looking at me differently," she said. "We’re neighbors because of who we are, not what we do, and I don’t want that to creep into my life again.”

Her fears extended beyond disrupting her quieter life.

“It’s not that I was afraid to let the fans down,” said Hamilton. “I was afraid to let Sarah Connor down.”

“This was 10 times the effort I put into the second one,” she remarked of prepping for the role.

“I had a true village of experts trying to get the most out of this bod.I don’t think there’s going to be one person who comes up to me who says, ‘You look so great for your age.’ I threw that into the Mississippi River, because that’s not what this is about. I want people to see me and go, ‘Oh my God, she got so old!’"

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Linda Hamilton, 'Terminator: Dark Fate' star, on celibacy, Hollywood
